Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Farfetched \Far"fetched`\, a. 1. Brought from far, or from a remote place. [1913 Webster]
Every remedy contained a multitude of farfetched and heterogeneous ingredients. --Hawthorne. [1913 Webster]
2. Studiously sought; not easily or naturally deduced or introduced; forced; strained; hence, implausible or improbable. [1913 Webster +PJC]
farfetched adj : highly imaginative but unlikely; "a farfetched excuse"; "an implausible explanation" [syn: {implausible}]
